metadata.synopsis: Halsin approaches you the morning after you celebrated your victory over the goblins. He now turns to the matter of your tadpole and how you might cure yourself - there is no quick solution, however. He tells you it'll be necessary to travel to a dangerous new region, and joins you at your camp to provide support.
metadata.how_to_trigger: loadlevel WLD_Main_Aoe readyattackondengoto 297.75, 35.51, -25.25Kill True Soul Gut1Kill Dror Ragzlinoe debugbook > go to region > act1 > groveBlow war horn to trigger raidKill Mintharagoto 399.91, 33.02, -29.76kill combat > Speak to Halsin / or halsin should have escapedgo back to grove to witness zevlor speech + halsins arrivalgo to camp + long restdialog should trigger after rest

104.speaker: Halsin
104.text: I trust you enjoyed your evening? After all your efforts, it was well-deserved.

76.speaker: Halsin
76.text: It may be some time before you are afforded another such night - there is much to be done.

60.speaker: Halsin
60.text: Moonrise Towers beckons. I've told you all I know, and now I'll join your camp to help you face whatever's to come.

32.speaker: Halsin
32.text: With luck, and the Oak Father's blessings, we might actually survive. Are you ready?

63.speaker: Player
63.text: Remind me - what exactly lies ahead?

14.speaker: Halsin
14.text: There is a terrible curse surrounding Moonrise Towers - a shadow curse that drains away all light and life.

142.speaker: Halsin
142.text: Few can resist it without dying, or transforming into shadow beings. You can try to journey overland if you wish, but I strongly advise you you go under.

19.speaker: Halsin
19.text: There is a tunnel leading from the temple of Selûne right down into the Underdark and beyond. The entrance is hidden somewhere in the ruins.

17.speaker: Halsin
17.text: I believe if you find this entrance, you'll discover a route that leads to Moonrise Towers, bypassing the worst of the shadow curse.

59.speaker: Halsin
59.text: Aradin and his lot were looking for the same entrance - they sought an artefact called the Nightsong that was supposed to be housed somewhere down there.

22.speaker: Player
22.text: All right. We'd better get moving.

89.speaker: Halsin
89.text: Onward then. We'll speak soon, I'm sure.

18.speaker: Halsin
18.text: It may be some time before you are afforded another such night - there is much to be done, and I promised I would help you however I could.

131.speaker: Halsin
131.text: I knew about your tadpole the moment I saw you. An archdruid knows all that is natural... and unnatural. I have studied this menace for some time, and wish to see it eradicated.

107.speaker: Halsin
107.text: I'm certain a cure for you can be found at Moonrise Towers, but it's... complicated.

67.speaker: Halsin
67.text: The journey, specifically - it's extremely perilous. Though it seems you're well accustomed to navigating danger.

41.speaker: Karlach
41.text: We get a cure and the chance to hit these arseholes where they live? Sounds good.

20.speaker: Halsin
20.text: To get to the Towers, you'll need to pass through a terrible place - a cursed place.

127.speaker: Halsin
127.text: This curse shrouds everything in shadow - you will not find life, light or anything natural there.

97.speaker: Halsin
97.text: Any who linger are twisted by the curse; they become shadow beings - tormented, dangerous souls.

99.speaker: Player
99.text: Sounds like I've no choice - I need to find a way through.

92.speaker: Halsin
92.text: You're half-right - you have to get to Moonrise, but you still have a choice of how to get there.

23.speaker: Player
23.text: The Absolute's forces can tolerate such a place?

31.speaker: Halsin
31.text: So it seems, though I don't know how. You will have to choose your approach carefully.

96.speaker: Halsin
96.text: You could go overland - along the Risen Road or through the mountains. Easier at first, but you'll run into the shadow curse eventually.

4.speaker: Halsin
4.text: You could also go under. There is a tunnel somewhere in the ruined temple of Selûne. It leads to Moonrise Towers through the Underdark.

133.speaker: Halsin
133.text: Long ago, a man called Ketheric Thorm built a secret stronghold deep down there, before rallying a whole army of Dark Justiciars - Shar worshippers.

25.speaker: Shadowheart
25.text: Dark Justiciars? I must see for myself.

35.speaker: Halsin
35.text: Aradin and his lot were looking for a way down there - they were promised riches if they retrieved a relic called the Nightsong. But I think there's more.

28.speaker: Halsin
28.text: From this stronghold, Ketheric's forces could access both the temple of Selûne and Moonrise Towers - but he was defeated before he could launch an attack.

143.speaker: Halsin
143.text: If you can find this place, I'll wager it will reveal a more direct path to Moonrise Towers, and may even bypass the worst of the shadow curse.

56.speaker: Player
56.text: I already found the place you're talking about - it's called Grymforge.
56.context: InternalNodeContext: This QN if the player has already entered the grymforge but has not yet spoken to Halsin about it.

57.speaker: Halsin
57.text: You've already been? Impressive. You'll make me redundant at this rate. What did you find?
57.context: NodeContext: Impressed and a little amused at the player's diligence (finding a place before he can even tell them about it)

54.speaker: Player
54.text: I found an elevator - but it leads right into the shadow curse.
54.context: InternalNodeContext: This node if the player clicked the elevator from Grymforge to SCL

115.speaker: Halsin
115.text: That sounds like what you need. But the next part of the journey mightn't be straightforward - or safe.

109.speaker: Halsin
109.text: It may prove impossible to avoid the shadow curse entirely, but if you find any way to limit your exposure, seize it.
109.context: InternalNodeContext: GLO_Halsin_AcknowledgedGrymforge sets whenever the player enquires about the Grymforge and Halsin acknowledges how it may relate to the journey to Moonrise.

138.speaker: Halsin
138.text: I would like to join your camp, if you'll allow me. I can offer my skills, my counsel.

2.speaker: Halsin
2.text: I've long sought to return to Moonrise Towers. It seems our fates have aligned.

16.speaker: Player
16.text: How do I find this passage through the Underdark?

108.speaker: Player
108.text: Say I decide to try this Underdark route after all - how do I get started?

21.speaker: Halsin
21.text: I advise you start in the temple of Selûne - if you find the Dark Justiciars' hidden entrance, it could lead you all the way to Moonrise.

114.speaker: Player
114.text: You want to come to Moonrise as well? Why?

47.speaker: Halsin
47.text: Unfinished business, and a lifetime of regret to repair.

68.speaker: Halsin
68.text: I helped overthrow Ketheric Thorm and his Dark Justiciars years ago. But I failed to prevent him from unleashing darkness across the region before he was defeated.

48.speaker: Halsin
48.text: I spent years researching the curse, trying to put an end to it. Nothing has worked - yet.

78.speaker: Halsin
78.text: If I can join you and get close to Moonrise, perhaps I can lift this curse, same as you may find a cure for your infection.

49.speaker: Player
49.text: Is that why you went with Aradin? You thought he might uncover this route to Moonrise?

94.speaker: Halsin
94.text: Precisely. Then perhaps I could have done something about both the shadow curse and ceremorphosis aberrations.

136.speaker: Halsin
136.text: But in my eagerness, I put far too much faith in the abilities of Aradin and his band. We didn't even get close.

51.speaker: Halsin
51.text: One of those who died had a clue that was supposed to help us find the hidden entrance to the Underdark.

52.speaker: Halsin
52.text: A dwarf called Brian, I believe. Though there's no guarantee that the goblins left him recognisable.

80.speaker: Halsin
80.text: It's lost to me. Perhaps in time I can open it up to the world again, but for now, I must help you.

13.speaker: Halsin
13.text: I've chosen a successor as First Druid - Francesca of the High Forest. A bird's already been dispatched to summon her.

55.speaker: Player
55.text: First and only Druid. What will Francesca even do here?

122.speaker: Halsin
122.text: She can tend to the grove, help it heal. In time, others will join. Perhaps some day I can return.

71.speaker: Halsin
71.text: A fellow druid. I can count on her to tend to the grove in my absence. Help it heal.

91.speaker: Halsin
91.text: Precisely! Who indeed? You do not know, and neither do any of the others.
91.context: NodeContext: Turning the player's question back on them - they've inadvertently stumbled upon the reasoning behind his decision

149.speaker: Player
149.text: There's nobody in the grove you'd choose?

113.speaker: Halsin
113.text: No. At least, not right now.

26.speaker: Player
26.text: What about one of the others? Rath, perhaps?

84.speaker: Halsin
84.text: Rath has promise, but he has a ways to go yet. He wasn't able to stop Kagha by himself. The grove needs experience and a strong hand.

77.speaker: Halsin
77.text: I need her to stay focused on her training - the grove will need a skilled healer in my absence.

134.speaker: Halsin
134.text: The grove needs to move beyond the mistakes of the past. What it needs is an unknown quantity; an outsider who can enforce the Oak Father's teachings without bias.

36.speaker: Halsin
36.text: This is why I chose Francesca. She will restore simplicity and purity to the grove in my absence.

8.speaker: Halsin
8.text: Contrary to how some think of us, we druids can play politics when necessary.

144.speaker: Halsin
144.text: Now, we've quite the journey ahead. Best get started.

137.speaker: Wyll
137.text: Let's not forget the devil Karlach. The Coast is in danger for as long as she's loosed on it. We need to find her - and kill her.

146.speaker: Lae'zel
146.text: Do not be so impatient to move on as Halsin. As ever, the githyanki crèche remains our priority.

53.speaker: Halsin
53.text: Resentment will spring up like mushrooms no matter what I do. You cannot please everyone and you'd be a fool to try.

100.speaker: Player
100.text: Sounds like the grove will be in good hands then. We should get going.

39.speaker: Halsin
39.text: Indeed. We've quite the journey ahead of us.

87.speaker: Halsin
87.text: I'm glad you approve - I do not truly care if you approve, but I am glad.

44.speaker: Player
44.text: Absolute followers - but that's about all.
44.context: InternalNodeContext: This node if the player didn't click the elevator from Grymforge to SCL

148.speaker: Halsin
148.text: Keep looking. If they're present, then it's likely there's a route to Moonrise somewhere.

37.speaker: Player
37.text: Danger. Are you sure that's the best way to Moonrise?

139.speaker: Halsin
139.text: I'm certain. The Underdark is dangerous, yes, but the alternative is suicide. Be patient and be thorough - the path will reveal itself in time.

66.speaker: Player
66.text: I've got more exploring to do.

129.speaker: Halsin
129.text: Tread carefully. You're on the right track, I'm sure - but there'll still be danger and difficulty before you reach Moonrise.

123.speaker: Player
123.text: I found the hidden entrance in the temple of Selûne - the way is clear.

116.speaker: Player
116.text: I've already found a way into the Underdark. I can pick up the trail from there.

7.speaker: Halsin
7.text: Already...? If only I'd gone with you instead of Aradin.

98.speaker: Player
98.text: So how do I find this underground route?

61.speaker: Halsin
61.text: You'll need to pick up where Aradin left off - find the hidden entrance. It's somewhere in the temple of Selûne.

85.speaker: Halsin
85.text: One of the adventurers had a clue to help find it - a dwarf called Brian. It might still be found on his corpse, wherever the goblins left it.

75.speaker: Player
75.text: I don't want to risk getting lost in the Underdark - I'll journey overland.

126.speaker: Halsin
126.text: You may reconsider once you see the effects of the curse for yourself.

82.speaker: Player
82.text: I never thought I'd say this, but it sounds like the Underdark is the safer route.

93.speaker: Halsin
93.text: Anything is preferable to risking the shadow curse.

34.speaker: Halsin
34.text: The decision is yours, but I'd favour the Underdark. Even a place like that is the lesser evil compared to the shadow-cursed lands.

24.speaker: Player
24.text: This shadow curse - does it affect Shar worshippers?

5.speaker: Halsin
5.text: I don't know. Ketheric's followers were defeated or vanished before the effects of the curse took hold.

105.speaker: Player
105.text: Are these Sharrans still to be found?

10.speaker: Halsin
10.text: As bones, perhaps. But their hidden structures might still remain.

130.speaker: Player
130.text: I know the Underdark - it's lethal. I'll travel overland.

43.speaker: Player
43.text: The Underdark's my home. Better to take that route than risk this curse.

38.speaker: Player
38.text: There must be another way to cure myself.

70.speaker: Halsin
70.text: By all means - pursue any leads you may have. But I sense all roads will lead to Moonrise.

3.speaker: Player
3.text: How are you so sure Moonrise is where I have to go?

103.speaker: Halsin
103.text: Nature speaks to me. Birds report what they've seen. And I've overheard goblins speaking of it, too. Moonrise is at the heart of all this, I'm sure of it.

65.speaker: Player
65.text: Moonrise Towers it is then. I'd better make haste.

69.speaker: Halsin
69.text: Wait. There's more you need to know.

150.speaker: Player
150.text: I was expecting more from you than a lead towards some distant, dangerous prospect.

95.speaker: Player
95.text: That's it? Just go to this place?

29.speaker: Halsin
29.text: What, were you expecting a spell? A potion? Or perhaps you thought I'd conduct a cack-handed operation on you right here.

40.speaker: Halsin
40.text: I won't be held accountable just because you're naive enough to expect easy answers. Now allow me to continue.

128.speaker: Halsin
128.text: What were you expecting? That I'd mumble a spell or whip out a potion?

121.speaker: Shadowheart
121.text: I suppose it was too much to hope we were going to be cured here and now. To Moonrise, then.

79.speaker: Wyll
79.text: To Moonrise Towers, then. May the sun and stars guide us.

140.speaker: Astarion
140.text: Finally, we're catching up on our puppet master. And the hunt ends at Moonrise Towers.
